# Task

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

In Julia, you can use the `lowercase`, `strip` and `replace` functions from Base to solve this problem. Here is an example of how this could be implemented:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), " " => "_")
end
```
This function takes a column name as input, converts it to lower case (to standardize the case), strips any leading or trailing white spaces, and replaces any space characters with underscore characters. The `replace` function from Base is used here for replacing substrings in strings.

For special instructions, you could modify this function:
```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), " " => "_")
end
```
This version of the function will perform as instructed, but it won't provide any benefit unless there is a specific requirement that needs to be met.
